wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup: 1/30/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top articles from around the industry so that you can stay up-to-date on the state of employee engagement in CSR and sustainability on the go.

Majority of U.S. Employees Not Engaged Despite Gains in 2014

Some of the big employee engagement numbers tossed around last year were from Gallup’s 2013 State of employee engagement reports. This week, Gallup released its survey results from interviews conducted in 2014 with over 80,000 employed adults. The interviews found a 1.9% increase in overall engagement (31.5%) from 2013 to 2014 with managers, executives, and officers recording to be most engaged. Conversely, employees in manufacturing or production jobs recorded the lowest levels of engagement. Interesting finding: Millennials were found to be the least engaged generation.

Five Hot HR Tech Trends for 2015 [Infographic]

According to analyst firm, The Starr Conspiracy Intelligence Unit, performance management, employee engagement, and learning are top-of-mind for HR executives in 2015. Using an infographic to summarize the findings, the research found that nearly 60% of HR personnel intend to purchase some type of HR technology solution this year. Interestingly enough, recruiting has fallen off the list of top priorities. (Hint: the infographic is on page 2 in the article)

It’s the value, stupid: 11 tools to boost the business case for CSR

The author urges that corporate social responsibility (CSR) programs be founded on the value for shareholders, local communities, and stakeholders. The success of programs relies on value interests of industry and stakeholders being aligned and maximized and the author provides 11 strategies to do so, including Communicate, but don’t overshare, Forget do-gooderism, and Stay consistent.

2015: the Year of Smarter Internal Communications

Social and mobile collaboration tools have dramatically changed how companies build their culture and increase productivity. Many companies are using these to improve employee engagement and build brand ambassadors from within’a very smart move in our perspective. The author compiled 5 internal communications trends to watch for in 2015, including Visualizing with Video, Going Mobile, Measuring Return on Communication’.

HR’s Role in an Engaged and Sustainable Workplace [White Paper]

Our latest white paper outlining the best practices employed by today’s forward-thinking HR leaders to unlock the potential of employee engagement via sustainability and Corporate Social Responsibility programs. In the white paper, we help you make the case by discussing the four key reasons why HR should focus on corporate sustainability’our favorite is #2.
